answers.author: Israel Murguia
answers.text:
Attached (page 12) you will find a study of government-led broadband infrastructure initiatives that include the following three local governments in Michigan: Oakland County, Washtenaw County, and Coldwater Michigan. In addition, you will find Evanston, IL broadband initiative. 
Also attached, is an example of a joint led project between the City of Peoria and the Peoria Unified School District to make fiber cable available for the City. In addition, included are case studies of successful initiatives for the City of Danville.  
Also, the following is a link of an article about the City of Oceanside, CA broadband initiative which linked all of its major facilities (saving $150,000 per year) while enabling accessibility to users across the network to voice, data, and video applications: http://www.tmcnet.com/usubmit/2004/Apr/1030777.htm
Then there is the classic example of Tacoma, WA successful broadband initiative, which served as an economic driving force for the city: http://www.siteselection.com/issues/2001/jan/p43/ 
For your reference, The Syracuse Municipal Broadband Initiative is also a successful example that has brought together technical and business expertise to establish a municipal broadband utility: http://syracusebroadband.org/node/21 
While not local initiatives, the following are some state led initiatives that have been successful in connecting cities throughout the respective states: Link Michigan, Iowa Communications Network, Virginia Link, and Arizona (TOPAZ), Utah (UTOPIA).
